title: Religious affairs ministry felicitates world champion Anas
body: The Ministry of Religious Affairs felicitated hafez Anas bin Atiq, 14, who has won first place in the 32nd International Hifzul Qur’an Competition held in Cairo, Egypt, at the Baitul Mukarram conference of Islamic Foundation in Dhaka on Friday. Presided over by director general of the Islamic Foundation Abdus Salam Khan, secretary of the ministry Md Kamal Uddin attended the reception as chief guest and presented the crest to Anas, said a press release. Among others, Islamic Foundation secretary Sheikh Murshidul Islam, director of the religious dawah and culture Mohammad Harunur Rashid, Markazut Tahfiz International Madrassa’s Shaykh Nesser Ahmed Nessari and Anas’ father Atiqur Rahman, among others, were present at the ceremony. Congratulating Anas, Kamal Uddin said that Anas had elevated Bangladesh to a high position in the world through this achievement. He said that the Islamic Foundation would take the initiative to publish a book on the achievements of the world-winning hafez and reciters. Anas won first place among the competitors from 70 countries of the world in the competition held from December 6 to 10 and achieved the glory of becoming the world champion.
